greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of strict integer partitions of n containing all prime indices of the parts.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
example: The first 15 terms count the following integer partitions.
An example for n = 6 is (20,18,11,5,3,2,1), with prime indices:
All of these prime indices {1,2,3,5} belong to the partition, as required.
xref: The subset version is A324736. The non-strict version is A324753. The Heinz number version is A290822. An infinite version is A324698.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 15 2019
